name: St. Silas
summary: Silas, also known as Silvanus, was a prominent member of the early Christian community in Jerusalem and a close companion of Paul the Apostle. He was chosen to deliver the decisions of the Council of Jerusalem to the Gentile churches. He accompanied Paul on his second missionary journey, helping to establish churches in Philippi, Thessalonica, and other cities. He is mentioned as a co-author of Paul's letters to the Thessalonians. According to tradition, he was martyred in Macedonia.
